required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a regulatory post-marketing surveillance in Japan, and it is a local prospective and observational study of patients who have received Magnevist at a dose of more than 0.2 ml/kg for MR angiography of peripheral vasculature with continuous imaging from the abdomen to the lower extremities. The objective of this study is to assess safety, especially in relation to renal dysfunction, and efficacy of using Magnevist in clinical practice. A total 2,000 patients will be recruited.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions and serious adverse events in subjects who received Magnevist
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Magnevist administration, up to 3 years

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions, especially Nephrogenic Systemic Fibrosis and Nephrogenic Fibrosing Dermopathy (NSF/NFD) in patients with reduced renal functions
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Magnevist administration, up to 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: MRI image evaluation assessment by the four rank scales of 1 to 4: 1) sufficient extraction; 2) almost sufficient extraction; 3) not sufficient extraction; and 4) insufficient extraction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Magnevist injection, up to 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions in subpopulation with baseline data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after Magnevist administration, up to 3 years

intervention.description: Patients who will need to undergo contrast enhanced MR angiography with Magnevist (a dosage of more than 0.2 mg/kg)

study_pop.textblock: The target population of this study is patients who received Magnevist for MR angiography. The study is expected to collect data of 2,000 patients in approximately 150 hospitals in Japan.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received a dose of more than 0.2 mg/kg of Magnevist for MR angiography of peripheral vasculature with continuous imaging from the abdomen to the lower extremities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are contraindicated based on the product label

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.
